New Records: Ronald Acuña Jr. became the first player in MLB history to have at least 40 homers and 70 stolen bases in a single season.
Key Match Events: Ronald Acuña Jr. stole his 69th and 70th bases during the game.
Acuña singled to drive in the tying run with one out in the 10th inning.
Acuña stole second base for his historic 70th stolen base before scoring the winning run on Ozzie Albies’ walk-off single.
Marcell Ozuna’s ninth-inning homer tied the score and forced extra innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Ronald Acuña Jr. expressed disbelief at reaching the 40-70 milestone, stating it seemed impossible.
Ozzie Albies and Marcell Ozuna both said that Acuña's performance should assure he wins the National League MVP award.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs were fighting for a wild-card postseason berth.
A crowd of more than 37,000 at Truist Park witnessed the historic moment.
